step1.para: With valves installed to protect seats, remove deposits and gasket material from valve heads and gasket surface with a scraper and wire brush. Be careful not to damage cylinder head gasket surface.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses with side shields whenever using compressed air for cleaning purposes. Limit the air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi). See "Safety Information."

step1.para: Use a suitable solvent to remove dirt, grease, and other deposits from parts removed.
Clean all bolt holes and be sure gasket surfaces, oil returns, and coolant passages are clean. After a thorough rinsing with hot water, blow out passages with filtered compressed air.
Wash all bolts and hardware (except head bolts, these must be replaced) with a suitable solvent and dry thoroughly.

note.para: Clean crankcase threads are essential. Dirt in threads or damaged threads may cause binding and will result in a false torque reading.

figure.caption: Cleaning the crankcase cylinder head bolt holes

step1.para: Use a Head Bolt Bottoming Tap to clean each tapped hole in crankcase top deck. Remove debris with filtered compressed air. See Special Service Tools.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, all head bolts must always be replaced when installing the cylinder head.

step1.para: Thoroughly clean each push rod using a suitable solvent and dry with filtered compressed air.
